column22: Director of Communications and Public Affairs
column23:
We are an international horse charity that improves the lives of horses in the UK and around the world through education, campaigning, and hands-on care.  
 
World Horse Welfare's vision is a world where every horse is treated with respect, compassion and understanding. Our mission is to work with horses, horse owners, communities, organisations and governments to help improve welfare standards and stamp out suffering in the UK and worldwide. 
 
We work across the UK with horses, horse owners, the veterinary profession, sport bodies, law enforcement and government to promote and protect the welfare of horses. 
 
Our network of Field Officers investigate and resolve thousands of reports of horses in distress made to our Welfare Line each year. Sometimes this can be as simple as advising owners, and where necessary we will take horses into our care. 
 
We are the UK's largest horse rescue and rehoming charity, and at our four Rescue and Rehoming Centres horses in need can receive urgent and specialist care. Once their rehabilitation is complete, we hope that every horse in our care can find a loving new home through our rehoming scheme - as valuable companions, competition horses, and everything in-between. 
 
Internationally, World Horse Welfare is committed to improving thousands of working equids’ lives and their owners’ livelihoods. Our practical international training programmes improve horse care and livelihoods in some of the world's poorest communities. Our training teams work with horse-owning communities to identify the barriers to better horse care, teach them new skills and help them better feed and tend to their most important asset. 
 
Our founding campaign was to end the long-distance transportation of horses across Europe to slaughter, and this remains a key goal of the organisation today. We also campaign on a range of diverse issues, including equine legislation in the UK, equine identification, welfare at slaughter and welfare in sport.

column26:
'Removing the Blinkers: the health and welfare of European equidae in 2015'. This ground-breaking report, produced following the first Commission Equine Expert's Meeting in 2014, aims to give a snapshot of the size, scope and impact of the sector, the welfare problems affecting equidae and makes recommendations to the Commission, Member State Competent Authorities and the equine industry on how equine health and welfare could be improved. See http://www.worldhorsewelfare.org/Removing-the-Blinkers 
 
'Practical Guidelines on the Watering of Equine Animals Transported by Road': guidance for anyone involved at any stage in the road transport of equidae, developed following extensive research and consultation by a working group which includes; World Horse Welfare, the Federation of Veterinarians in Europe, the Federation of European Equine Veterinary Associations, the Animal Transportation Association, Animals’ Angels and The Donkey Sanctuary. See: http://www.worldhorsewelfare.org/guidance

column23:
The European co-operation for Accreditation or EA is an association of national accreditation bodies in Europe that are officially recognised by their national Governments to assess and verify—against international standards—organisations that carry out evaluation services such as certification, verification, inspection, testing and calibration (also known as conformity assessment services). 
 
EA has been formally appointed as the body responsible for the European accreditation infrastructure in Regulation (EC) No 765/2008 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 9 July 2008, Article 14, paragraph 6. 
In accordance with Article 14, paragraph 2 in this Regulation, an agreement has been concluded between EA and the European Commission (EC) to specify, inter alia, EA’s detailed tasks as well as funding and supervision provisions. 
 
EA exists to coordinate and lead the European accreditation infrastructure to allow the results of conformity assessment services in one country to be accepted by Regulators and the market place in another country without further examination, for the benefit of the European community and the global economy.

column23: WUNRN Europe is Belgian ASBL registered organisation   and is aims to work within the EU. column25:
WUNRN Europe follows initiatives involving women and young girls. We document issues that relate to women and young girls on a European and global level. 
We will closely be following the committees on Femm, the legislative framework on platforms such as Beijing +20 in which we already participate. 
Also any gender equality Policy hearings, events and workshops to inform policy on gender.
column26:

column23:
Farmers Parliament  is the voice of Latvian  farming. 
 
Farmers Parliament (ZSA) is a member organisation / industry association for farmers in Latvia. 
 
The Union was begun by 134 farmers in 1999 to ensure that the comercial farmers of Latvia are represented in communication with the government. The organisation has grown ever since and has become the largest farmers’ organisation in Latvia and one of the most influential unions in the country, reaching nearly 900 members, who together produce more than half of Latvian total agriculture produce. Farmers Parliament negotiates with the government and national organisations and institutions on behalf of Latvian farmers, as well as represents Latvian farmers’ interests at European Union level being a member in European Farmers umbrella organisation COPA/COGECA 
Organization Goals: 
To represent the interests of Latvian local farmers both at national and European Union level; 
To cooperate with national and international private and public institutions and organisations in order to provide best services for Union members; 
To ensure information, consultation and training for union members, other farmers and general public.

column5: European Chamber of Commerce in Korea (ECCK)
column23:
As the only European advocacy in Korea, the European Chamber of Commerce in Korea (ECCK) is committed to advancing the interests of companies from European Union (EU) and European Free Trade Association (EFTA) member states operating in Korea. Furthermore, it cooperates with organizations that share mutual interests to promote optimal business environment and fairly represent the European business community. To achieve these objectives, the ECCK focuses on: 
 
1. Ensuring a fair and open business environment by facilitating dialogue with the government 
2. Collecting and disseminating information on the business as well as economic and regulatory developments in Korea and Europe 
3. Creating networking opportunities for its members 
4. Contributing to the Korean society by supporting corporate social responsibility activities and promoting good corporate governance practices
column25: The European Chamber of Commerce in Korea (ECCK) is primarily focusing on the KOR-EU FTA. Although the ECCK is not officially involved in any EU initiative except being subcontracted for the EU Gateway Programme, the ECCK is heavily involved in many activities reconciled with the Delegation of the European Union to the Republic of Korea.

column5: Asociación para la Defensa de la Naturaleza (WWF España)
column9: Gran Vía de San Francisco, 8 Esc D
column23:
WWF trabaja por un planeta vivo y su misión es detener la degradación ambiental de la Tierra y construir un futuro en el que el ser humano viva en armonía con la naturaleza: 
- Conservando la diversidad biológica mundial 
- Asegurando que el uso de los recursos naturales renovables sea sostenible  
- Promoviendo la reducción de la contaminación y el consumo desmedido
column25: #NAME?
column26:
LÍNEA ESTRATÉGICA 1. Creación de alianzas, participación y sensibilización con sectores clave para 
mejorar las prácticas ambientales 
 
Crear alianzas 
− Con los gestores forestales para promover la certificación FSC. 
− Con la industria pesquera española para elaborar planes de gestión multianuales, ajustar la capacidad, 
luchar contra la pesca IUU y promover la certificación pesquera. 
− Con sectores clave para impulsar la eficiencia energética y para recuperar liderazgo en energía renovables. 
 
Fomentar la participación 
− De todos los actores afectados por la gestión del agua. 
− De todos los grupos de interés en la gestión sostenible de pesquerías. 
 
Sensibilizar a actores clave 
− Para reducir el impacto de los incendios forestales. 
− Para reducir las nuevas amenazas sobre las especies prioritarias. 
− Sobre el impacto del cambio climático y la necesidad de un cambio en el modelo energético. 
 
Promover y gestionar el voluntariado ambiental 
 
Participar en órganos e instituciones 
− Integrar las acciones de conservación a nivel internacional en la red WWF. 
 
LÍNEA ESTRATÉGICA 2. Trabajo sobre el terreno para mejorar la conectividad mediante la 
restauración, la gestión y las buenas prácticas en la utilización de los recursos 
 
Gestión y buenas prácticas 
− Realizar proyectos demostrativos para impulsar instrumentos de gestión y fomentar buenas prácticas 
agrarias, forestales y cinegéticas con criterios WWF, que incorporen la adaptación al cambio climático. 
− Realizar actuaciones de conservación sobre el terreno para minimizar amenazas y recuperar las 
poblaciones de especies amenazadas prioritarias. 
− Desarrollar proyectos demostrativos de rehabilitación energética de edificios y autoconsumo con 
renovables. 
 
Conectividad 
− Realizar proyectos y acciones de lobby para mejorar la conectividad y fomentar las infraestructuras verdes 
en zonas prioritarias WWF, aplicando distintas herramientas (corredores, áreas refugio, restauraciones, 
GAP). 
− Realizar proyectos y acción política para crear una red de áreas marina protegidas en España según los 
criterios WWF. 
 
LÍNEA ESTRATÉGICA 3. Fomento del consumo responsable para transformar los mercados 
− Crear alianzas con los principales consumidores públicos y privados para incrementar la demanda de 
productos forestales certificados procedentes de bosques en regiones prioritarias para WWF. 
− Crear alianzas con supermercados para mejorar sus criterios de compra de productos agrícolas y difundir 
hábitos de consumo responsable. 
− Crear alianzas con supermercados para asegurar que el consumidor compra productos pesqueros obtenidos 
de forma sostenible. 
 
LÍNEA ESTRATÉGICA 4. Acción política para cambiar el modelo económico y de desarrollo  
− Influir en la elaboración y aplicación de las políticas, planes y proyectos que afectan a la gestión del agua. 
− Influir para impulsar herramientas innovadoras en la gestión de los recursos naturales. 
− Influir para asegurar la conservación efectiva de los ecosistemas costeros prioritarios para WWF. 
− Colaborar con la red WWF para mejorar las normativas internacionales y su trasposición (ER y EE) y para hacer seguimiento de los acuerdos internacionales en materia de cambio climático (IPCC, COP). 
 
LÍNEA ESTRATÉGICA 5. Estrategia jurídica y acciones legales necesarias para lograr los objetivos 
ambientales 
− Garantizar el cumplimiento de los compromisos supranacionales. 
− Impulsar la mejora de la legislación ambiental. 
− Garantizar el cumplimiento de la legislación de medio ambiente.

column26:
EU Nature Alert: Srce europskog zakonodavstva o zaštiti prirode su Direktiva o staništima i Direktiva o pticama, nevladine organizacije iz zemalja EU okupile su se u borbi protiv revidiranja propisa koji štite europsku prirodu, a nakon 1161 dana uvjeravanja, Europska komisija složila se da su direktive dobre te da ih treba samo bolje provoditi. U toj akciji nevladinom je sektoru pomoglo više od 520.000 ljudi koji su dali glas za spas direktiva tijekom javnog savjetovanja Europske komisije – najveći odaziv u povijesti EU!  
Program Zaštićena područja za prirodu i ljude provodimo s ciljem povezivanja zaštićenih područja i lokalnog stanovništva. Ovaj program sadrži elemente EU politika iz područja zaštite okoliša i prirode, a usmjeren je na prepoznavanje vrijednosti usluga ekosustava i poboljšanje upravljanja zaštićenim područjima. Koristimo alat za vrednovanje koristi zaštićenih područja (PA BAT – protected areas benefit assessment tool), kojim se podiže svijest dionika o vrijednosti koju im zaštićeno područje donosi. Unutar programa osnovana je asocijacija „Parkovi Dinarida – mreža zaštićenih područja Dinarida“ za suradnju i izmjenu iskustava među parkovima te doprinijeti promicanju održivog razvoja u parkovima regije.   
Program zaštite slatkovodnih ekosustava temelji se na promicanju i monitoringu provođenja Direktive 2000/60/EZ, Direktive 2014/52/EU, Direktive 2001/42/EZ i Direktivi 92/43/EEZ, a trenutno se sastoji od dva projekta. Inicijativa za održivu hidroenergetiku u Dinarskom luku, u cilju zaštite slatkovodnih ekosustava u regiji od neplanskog i neodrživog razvoja hidroelektrana, promiče strateško planiranje na razini riječnog sliva (plan upravljanja vodnim područjem), te izradu sveobuhvatne, cjelovite i objektivne procjene utjecaja na okoliš i prirodu sukladno. Unutar projekta izrađena je cjelokupna analiza rijeka u AL, BiH, CG i HR, s označenim rijekama od iznimnog značaja čijoj zaštiti je potrebno posvetiti pažnju prilikom planiranja infrastrukturnih projekata. Rezultati ove analize sažeti su u publikaciji „Rijeke: Linije života Dinarskog luka“, dok je u sklopu projekta objavljenja i publikacija „Put ka održivoj hidroenergiji u Dinarskom luku“.  Zaštita europske linije života je projekt čiji je cilj osigurati zaštitu i dobro upravljanje prekograničnim riječnim ekosustavom Mure, Drave i Dunava, kako bi se očuvale jedinstvene prirodne i kulturne vrijednosti te unaprijedila kvaliteta života stanovnika tog područja.  
Razvoj održivih gospodarskih aktivnosti u morskim zaštićenim područjima (SEA-Med) kroz podršku provedbi planova upravljanja morskih zaštićenih područja, razvojem planova održivog turizma, promicanjem inicijative turizma temeljenog na prirodnim vrijednostima, prepoznavanjem financijskih mehanizama morskih zaštićenih područja i promicanjem održivog ribarstva. 
Promicanje održivog ribarstva je projekt koji se provodi u 11 europskih zemalja uključujući HR i SI. Ljude diljem Europe potiče se da gledaju izvan granica zemalja u kojima žive te saznaju više o tome kako njihov izbor proizvoda iz ribarstva utječe na društvo i okoliš. WWF nastoji povećati znanje i informiranost potrošača, korporativnog sektora i vlasti kako održiva hrana može napraviti razliku. U tom pogledu, globalno smanjenje siromaštva i ekološki napredak su u središtu ovog projekta. Temelj projekta je u Zajedničkoj ribarstvenoj politici EU. 
Promoviranje održivog gospodarenja šumama kao potpora održivom razvoju u BiH projekt je koji WWF provodi u partnerstvu s IKEA-om. Nakon uspješno zaključenog dvogodišnjeg projekta tijekom kojeg je FSC certifikatom certificirano čak 56.000 hektara šuma u Tuzlanskoj županiji, u njegovu nastavku radi se na razvoju jedinstvenih FSC standarda za gospodarenje šumskim resursima u BiH, unaprjeđenju procesa izdvajanja šuma visoke zaštitne vrijednosti, edukaciji stručnjaka iz sektora šumarstva i d

column23:
The EUROPARC Federation, known as the "Federation of Nature and National Parks of Europe", was founded in 1973. The aim of the organisation was then and still is to help protected areas fulfill their role as preservers of the natural beauty of Europe in all its variety for us to experience and enjoy, to encourage cooperation and exchange between their managers and staff, and to promote their aims and work across the Europe. 
EUROPARC's mission is to be the leading European organisation for protected areas bringing together dedicated professionals, governmental agencies, decision makers and supporters to increase effectiveness in conserving and enhancing natural and cultural heritage on land and sea for the well-being and benefit of current and future generations.
column25:
The work of Protected Areas across Europe makes a valuable contribution across several European Union policy areas, notably on nature and biodiversity through the management of much of the Natura 2000 network, as well as through sustainable and rural development. There are also many linkages to other areas of work that affect Protected Areas, such as agriculture, regional development and education. Through its Brussels office, EUROPARC ensures direct connection with European Institutions, including the EU Commission, the European Parliament and the Committee of the Regions. We represent members interests at European level and actively contribute to the development of EU relevant policies, providing expertise, facilitating the exchange of experiences and driving the flow of information from and to our members. 
Regular meetings with regional authorities and other institutions together with the representation of our members in various meetings, seminars and international conferences are also part of our daily work in Brussels. In particular EUROPARC works closely with the European Habitats Forum and is represented on the N2000 Expert Working group and the EU platform on coexistence between people and large carnivores. 
Information arising from our representations, meetings and work with European institutions, will be regularly posted on our website, facebook and twitter feeds. 
At international level EUROPARC is also working in close cooperation with the Council of Europe
column26:
EUROPARC works both for implementation and development of EU policies, with a main focus on Nature and Biodiversity. EF is actively involved to contribute to the implementation of the 7th Environmental Action Programme and of the EU 2020 Biodiversity Strategy. In this context EF is currently actively involved in the following: the effective implementation of the Natura 2000 Network, the Green Infrastructure Strategy, the integration of biodiversity priorities within agriculture and tourism policies, the knowledge improvement on ecosystem services and wilderness conservation. 
Sustainable Tourism, Regional Development, Common agricultural policy, Youth Education and Climate Change are also other policies we follow from close, both in terms of development and implementation. 
Nature knows no boundaries and we therefore facilitate international co-operation in all aspects of Protected Area management to improve and conserve our shared natural inheritance. This implies an active work on communication to ensure that information are delivered in both directions: from managers towards the EU decision makers and from them back to the managers. EF has a well established and efficient communication system and network to reach members and interested partners all over Europe: a multi language website, twitter and Facebook accounts, together with linkedin and flicker for the dissemination of information and news. EF publishes a bimonthly news and an annual publication Protected Areas In-Sight. Further an annual report is also published every year.  
EF organizes annually an international conference for 300 PA managers and experts fro all over Europe. We organize also seminars, workshops and trainings for members and partners to ensure the exchange of good practices, increase the awareness on EU policies and to raise the awareness and expertise in PAs management.  
EF is actively involved in several international projects with partners from all over Europe to support PA and improve the management of natural resources.
column27:
EUROPARC has established good cooperation and contributes to the work of the following intergroup of the European Parliament: 
 Intergroup Climate Change, Biodiversity and Sustainable Development 
Intergroup European tourism development, cultural heritage, Way of St. James and other European cultural routes

IUCN: the world’s oldest and largest global environmental network - a democratic membership union with more than 1,000 government and NGO member organizations, and almost 11,000 volunteer scientists in more than 160 countries. 
 
European Habitats Forum (EHF): a group of NGO networks that provide input and advice to DG Environment and the Nature Directors in EU Member States, particularly relating to the implementation of the Birds and Habitats Directives and the establishment of the Natura 2000 network.

column23:
SHA is a non-profit consultancy from the Netherlands, founded in 1992. It aims to benefit present and future generations, following policies and action points of the United Nations agenda for a sustainable society in the 21st C. Various chapters of this “Agenda 21” are integrated for the development of Green Health Care and other concepts and programs. 
 
SHA’s vision: in addition to socially responsible products and services, the transformation to a sustainable society requires cross-disciplinary knowledge building, cross-sectorsal policy development, and above all, an integrated approach to the solution of current social issues.
column25: Policy development on the environmental cycle of human and veterinary pharmaceuticals and (eg. antibiotic) resistant micro-organisms.
column26:
SHA is currently working with institutions, organisations and companies on the introduction of cross-sector concepts like Green Chemistry and Green Pharmacy, see www.groenegezondheid.nl (partly in English). 
 
Between 2017 and 2020 SHA coordinates the EU INTERREG-VA-Project MEDUWA-Vecht(e) with 27 German and Dutch partners, see http://www.groenegezondheid.nl/link.php?title=MEDUWA_English 
  
The Green Pharmacy Conference of October 2017 at the University Medical Centre of Utrecht, The Netherlands, is co-organized by SHA, see further vvm.info/greenpharmacy

column5: Office International du Coin de Terre et des Jardins Familiaux (OICTJF)
column23:
L'Office International favorise la création d'organisation de jardiniers amateurs en Europe, favorise le développement de ces regroupements et défend leurs intérêts. Il s'efforce à créer avec ses membres des ensembles de jardins familiaux et de les protéger juridiquement à travers toute l'Europe. 
Il s'efforce de sensibiliser les autorités locales, régionales et nationales ainsi que les organisations européennes et internationales aux besoins des jardiniers amateurs.  
Il oeuvre pour créer des jardins à des conditions favorables destinées à des familles et des personnes individuelles pour leur procurer de cette façon un moyen de détente et d'amélioration de leurs ressources. Il oeuvre pour intégrer par exemple les personnes âgées, les réfugiés et les personnes handicapées.  
Il contribue par son travail à la protection de la nature et de l'environnement, oeuvre pour réduire les effets du changement climatique, contribue à l'amélioration de la qualité de la vie urbaine et au développement durable. 
Il s'efforce de sensibiliser les enfants pour la nature et l'environnement et de former les adolescents et les jeunes à la pratique du jardinage, de leur donner le goût du travail de la terre et de les intéresser à tous qui touche la nature. 
L'Office oeuvre afin que la convivialité soit stimulée par une participation à la vie associative afin de favoriser ainsi un équilibre entre les classes sociales. Il contribue à la cohésion sociale.
column25: Protection de la nature et de l'environnement, développement durable, protection des plantes, non-utilisation des pesticides par exemple: directive no. 2009/128/EG, changement climatique, déclin des pollinisateurs
column26: L'Office organise chaque année alternativement une session d'étude, un séminaire et un congrès. La session d'étude de 2015 préparant le prochain congrès 2016 à Vienne avait pour sujet: Les conseils de jardinage de l'avenir tenant compte de la durabilité et de la gestion responsable des ressources. La réunion de Copenhague en 2017 a traité la problématique de l'avenir du mouvement des jardins familiaux dans un contexte urbain modifié. Lors de la session d'étude 2018 il discute la place des jardins familiaux dans le développement urbain. Il édite trois fois par an une revue traitant de ces sujets et édite des brochures par exemple sur un jardinage respectueux de la nature, sur la responsabilité sociale des jardiniers associés, sur la sensibilisation des enfants pour la nature et l'environnment. Il décerne des diplômes pour un jardinage respectueux de la nature, des activités sociales et des projets innovants. Pendant la période 2017 - 2019 la thématique de la protection des sols sera discutée. Une brochure concernant les projets innovants dans les jardins familiaux ainsi que sur la protection des sols sont en préparation.

column4: Non-governmental organisations, platforms and networks and similar
column23:
Dianova International es una ONG que coordina una red de organizaciones en 17 países de 4 continentes (Europa, América, África, Asia) dedicadas al desarrollo de personas, comunidades y entidades, implementando acciones de incidencia social y política que contribuyen a los Objetivos de Desarrollo Sostenible de las Naciones Unidas. 
Está constituida por un conjunto de organizaciones autónomas que desarrollan programas sociales y proyectos innovadores principalmente en las áreas temáticas de: los niños/as, jóvenes y la educación; salud, adicciones y salud mental; protección social y humanitaria; alianzas y cooperación; y el combate a la pobreza y la igualdad de género (a nivel transversal). La misión de la organización es desarrollar acciones y programas que contribuyan activamente a la autonomía personal y al progreso social. 
Dianova International abarca a miembros ordinarios, afiliados y asociados cuyo compromiso se basa en principios y valores similares, si embargo, sólo los miembros ordinarios comparten el mismo objetivo social, tal como se define en su Visión y Misión comunes.Su tarea es definir la política general y coordinar las iniciativas de la Red, así como brindar un apoyo financiero y técnico a la acción individual de sus miembros. Dianova International representa a los miembros de la red ante organismos internacionales.
column25:
A nivel europeo e internacional en Dianova hacemos incidencia política sobre; políticas de drogas y adicciones; igualdad de género y empoderamiento de la mujer; refugiados y migrantes; y economia social y tercer sector. 
En el ámbito de drogas seguimos muy de cerca la Estrategia Europea sobre Drogas (2013-2020), el Plan de Acción sobre Drogas (2017-2020), las iniciativas sobre los estándares de calidad en el tratamiento de adicciones, y el posicionamiento de la UE ante organismos internacionales (como la Comisión de Estupefacientes o el Segmento Ministerial de Alto Nivel del 2019).
column26:
La red Dianova y Dianova International contribuyen a la implementación del Plan de Acción de Drogas de la UE (2017-2020), especialmente en lo que se refiere a la reducción de la demanda. 
 
Dianova International promociona la participación de proyectos europeos en la red Dianova. Los miembros de la red Dianova gestionan proyectos europeos en los ámbitos de drogas, educación y proyectos nacionales co-financiados por la UE. En total, los miembros de la red Dianova han participado en alrededor de 50 proyectos co-financiados por la UE en el periodo 2009-2015. En Dianova International estamos interesados en informarnos sobre las líneas de financiación y en la búsqueda de socios para los proyectos europeos.  
 
Comunicación a nuestro publico sobre las novedades de políticas y proyectos europeos principalmente a través de la web de Dianova International y nuestras redes sociales. 
 
Además, organizamos eventos a nivel de la UE o en otros organismos internationals (como la Comisión de Estupefacientes y la Comisión del Estatus Jurídico de la Mujer de Naciones Unidas y en ellos presentamos las buenas prácticas de nuestros miembros.  
A modo de ejemplo, el 23 de septiembre de 2015 organizamos junto al Eurodiputado Michal Boni (EPP) y la organización EURAD un evento en el Parlamento Europeo en Bruselas sobre la revision de la política mundial de drogas (UNGASS) al que asistieron más de 100 personas.  
 
El 17 de marzo del 2016, OID organizó un evento paralelo a la Comisión de Estupefacientes sobre “Tratamientos  de drogas en el sur de Europa: proporcionando soluciones en tiempos de crisis”.

column5: Asociación para la Autorregulación de la Comunicación Comercial (AUTOCONTROL)
column23: Organismo español que gestiona, desde 1995, el sistema español de autorregulación publicitaria sobre la base de tres instrumentos principales: Código de Conducta Publicitaria; un órgano independiente (el Jurado de AUTOCONTROL de la Publicidad), que se encarga de resolver las controversias y reclamaciones, y un Gabinete Técnico formado Formado por profesionales expertos en Derecho de la Publicidad, Privacidad y Protección de Datos e informática con dedicación exclusiva para AUTOCONTROL, que se encargan de asesorar a las empresas en el cumplimiento de sus obligaciones legales en estos ámbitos. Nuestra actividad incluye: La tramitación de reclamaciones en relación con comunicaciones comerciales, presentadas por consumidores, asociaciones de consumidores, empresas y Administración; el asesoramiento a las empresas a través de las herramientas de Copy Advice® (asesoramiento sobre la corrección ética y legal de las campañas publicitarias antes de su emisión); Cookie Advice® (asesoramiento técnico y jurídico sobre utilización de cookies); Data Advice (asesoramiento jurídico en materia de protección de datos) y Web Advice (asesoramiento sobre cumplimiento de la normativa publicitaria en páginas web) y la formación (Ofrecemos cursos y seminarios dirigidos tanto a profesionales del derecho o de la publicidad que desean profundizar en sus conocimientos en materia como a recién graduados que quieren orientar su carrera profesional). AUTOCONTROL está compuesto por los principales Anunciantes, Agencias de Publicidad, Medios de Comunicación y Asociaciones profesionales relacionadas con la actividad publicitaria en España.

column23: Ecopreneur.eu, the European Sustainable Business Federation,sets a course toward sustainable economic policies on the European level to support the economic and societal transformation across Europe and beyond. Ecopreneur.eu aims at opening solidified structures and brings sustainable matters to European policy makers. In 2016 Ecopreneur.eu acquired official legal status as an "association internationale sans but lucratif" (aisbl), a non-profit non-governmental organization under Belgian law. The organization is quickly growing and now holds seven associations from different countries of the European Union: UnternehmensGrün (Germany), Grüne Wirtschaft (Austria), Entreprendre Vert (France), MVO Nederland / De Groene Zaak (Netherlands), ECOVE (Spain), SEA (Belgium) and Circular Hungary. Through Ecopreneur.eu these associations strengthen the voice of sustainable business in Brussels. Under the roof of Ecopreneur.eu, more than 2500 green, circular and sustainable businesses are represented – mostly SMEs. These companies are all truly ethical businesses striving for offering sustainable products and services in order to solve societal challenges and serve to mitigate climate change.

- to accelerate the development of the concept "Green Design" on a global scale,

- to contribute to the fight against climate change, 
- to create a communication platform focused on ecological and environmental issues, 
- to promote communication and cooperation on environmental issues globally, 
- to support activities in favor of an environmental shift in economy, trade and investment.

Le Monde selon les femmes est une ONG féministe active dans le monde du développement, de l'éducation permanente, de la recherche action; elle valorise les savoirs locaux en appui aux mouvements sociaux. Sa vision est celle d’un monde où l’on aurait transformé les rapports de domination entre les femmes et les hommes et entre le Nord et le Sud en relations construites sur l’égalité et la solidarité. Elle reconnait l’interdépendance des sociétés et l’enrichissement mutuel. 
 
Elle s'adresse au Nord et au Sud, aux instances et personnes susceptibles de jouer un rôle multiplicateur, tant dans le secteur marchand et non-marchand que de la coopération au développement (institutions gouvernementales et non- gouvernementales), des institutions internationales, du monde politique, des syndicats et des médias.

column23:
The OeGVH represents the veterinary homeopaths of Austria. 
Die ÖGVH vertritt die Veterinärhomöopathen Österreichs. 
 
public relations/ Öffentlichkeitsarbeit 
 
Public relations activities like the new homepage, facebook and events like the "day of homeopathy" at the University of Veterinary   Medicine in Vienna hand on information to pet owners. 
Öffentlichkeitsarbeit via Homepage, Facebook und Infoveranstaltungen wie z.B der "Tag der Homöopathie" auf der Veterinärmedizinischen Universität bringen die Homöopathie den Tierbesitzern näher. 
 
Knowledge/ Wissen 
 
One of main goals of the OeGVH is to provide information about the theory of homeopathy and the newest research in this field to improve deficiencies of knowledge about homeopathy. 
Erklärtes Ziel ist es Wissensdefizite bei Tierbesitzern und Tierärzten durch Informationen aus erster Hand zu beseitigen und neueste Erkenntnisse zu Verfügung zu stellen. 
 
Education/ Ausbildung 
 
Education of veterinarians is important. The OeGVH provides information about courses and organizes two congresses per year.  
Ausbildung und Weiterbildung von Tierärzten ist wichtig. Die ÖGVH bietet sich als Informationsplattform für fundierte Aus- und Weiterbildungen im Bereich der Veterinärhomöopathie für Tierärzte an.

column23:
South Muntenia Regional Development Agency (SMRDA) is a non-governmental agency, non-profit and of public utility and its mission is to develop and implement regional policies and programme that lead towards the alleviation of economic and social imbalances across the region and contribute to a further sustainable and balanced development. 
 The main fields aimed by the regional policies and programs are fostering the entrepreneurship and innovation, balancing the labor market, stimulating the technology transfer, attracting inward investment, development of SMEs, improvement of infrastructure, supporting the transition to a low-carbon economy, etc. In this regard, the Agency identifies and develops projects of local and regional interest as well as projects of intraregional cooperation and it is actively involved in all the phases of the regional development (programming, implementing, monitoring and evaluation).  
With the support of the Regional Development Board, the Agency actively promotes the region and fosters inward investment attraction and export, develops partnerships with similar bodies and institutions from the European Union and participates in international projects.
column25:
South Muntenia Regional Development Agency is actively involved in all the phases of the regional development (programming, implementing, monitoring and evaluation). To that respect, the Agency has designed the Regional Development Plans for the 2004-2006 and 2007-2013 programming periods, also feeding into the National Development Plan 2007-2013 and Regional Operational Programme 2007-2013 and 2014-2020. 
  
Also, in close cooperation with the Minister for Economy and the Regional Chamber of Commerce, it has prepared the Regional Export Strategy 2006 – 2009 and participated to the design of the National Export Strategies for 2006 – 2009 and 2010 – 2013. Starting with 2007, part of the Agency is acting as Intermediate Body for the Regional Operational Programme 2007-2013 and is evaluating the impact achieved through the implementation of projects within the region. 
 
In addition, starting with 2011 the Development Directorate, through its Professional Training Department organizes, coordinates and provides professional training to unemployed and personnel employed, in order to improve and diversify the professional competences and skills of the people in accordance with the job market requirement. 
Also, starting with 2013, another part of the Agency is acting as Intermediate Body for SOP IEC – Sectoral Operational Programme “Increasing of  Economic Competitiveness”, financed by ERDF.
column26: South Muntenia Regional Development Agency has a strong expertise in the management of EU Structural Funds (especially FEDR -   Regional Operational Programme - project evaluation and monitoring) and continues to participate in a wide range of European interregional and transnational programmes with emphasis on research, entrepreneurship and promoting innovation. The Agency has wide experience in managing and delivering such projects and in working on a transnational basis with a large number of international partners. This is reflected through the implementation of the following projects: “Innovating South Muntenia”,  PROSME – Promotion of Romanian SMEs through Enterprise Europe Network”, “PROSME-INN- Improving RO3 SMEs management of innovation’,  “Training and Assessment Programme for NEETs for full inclusion in the labour market and EU society – NoNEETs”, “Empowering entrepreneurial skills and unleashing potential of unemployed seniors – MYBUSINESS” and “Life coaching and mentoring empowerment for women for a new start - NEW START”.

column5: MBO BE AND LIVE (MBO B & L)
column23:
L’Association MBO B & L est une organisation sans but lucratif, libre et au service des populations des pays en développement et en particulier des pays d’Afrique centrale. 
 
L’Association  poursuit les buts suivants : 
 
- Soutenir les peuples autochtones dans la défense de leurs droits, en particulier auprès des institutions internationales, et des gouvernements locaux. 
 
- Elle est une organisation de service qui œuvre pour le respect et la préservation des cultures des peuples autochtones minoritaires :  Elle agit de concert avec eux, en les consultant sur les activités à réaliser, et en leur apportant un soutien possible.  
 
- Promeut et soutien les Peuples autochtones minoritaires  dans le domaine économique, social et la mise en place des infrastructures culturelles ainsi que la réalisation des programmes de développement communautaires et des projets dans les domaines de l’éducation, de la santé, de l’agriculture et la lutte contre l’insécurité alimentaire en Afrique centrale. 
 
- Soutien la culture, le patrimoine, les arts,  l’éducation, la formation et la préservation des droits existentiels des peuples autochtones MBO  d’Afrique centrale ( Cameroun ), ainsi que l’amélioration du bien-être social et économique des populations autochtones MBO. 
 
- L’organisation a pour vocation d’impliquer et d’engager les peuples autochtones d’Afrique centrale, comme citoyens dans la vie sociale, économique et culturelle de leur pays d’accueil de manière responsable et efficace.  
 
- Elle assure le rôle d’interface des citoyens membres de ces peuples vis à vis des pays hôtes.                                                                                                                                                                              
 
- MBO B & L joue également le rôle d’informateur/intermédiaire dans le développement de programmes économiques et programmes de développement potentiels. 
 
- L’Association MBO B & L a pour objectif majeur de contribuer à améliorer les conditions de vie des hommes et des femmes, dans une perspective de progrès global et de développement durable.  
 
Pour y arriver, elle se focalise particulièrement sur les politiques extérieures et de coopération au développement de l'Union européenne ainsi que sur les interactions possibles entre ces politiques et d’autres secteurs d’activités ayant un impact sur les conditions de vie des populations des pays en développement en Afrique centrale et de leurs ressortissants.
column25:
Nous souhaitons vivement suivre des dossiers législatifs touchant principalement aux activités qui sont les nôtres dans les domaines suivants : 
 
- Politique européenne de coopération au développement  
- Affaires extérieures  
- Partenariat Afrique Union européenne  
- Droits de l'Homme 
- Migrations 
 
L’Antenne du MBO B & L en Europe a pour vocation de faciliter le transfert d’informations entre les peuples autochtones d’Afrique centrale et les institutions européennes. 
 
Elle vise à soutenir les représentants des peuples autochtones minoritaires souhaitant alerter l’UE sur les problématiques de terrain auxquelles sont confrontées leur communauté en les conseillant dans leur prise de contact avec les institutions à Bruxelles ainsi qu’avec les Délégations de l’UE dans leurs pays en Afrique centrale.

column5: European Regional Focal Point for Animal Genetic Resources (ERFP)
column9: Institut de l’Elevage (IDELE) Département Génétique et Phénotypes 149 rue de Bercy
column23:
The ERFP objectives are:  
 
  
• to support the in situ and ex situ conservation and sustainable use of AnGR in European countries. 
 
• to facilitate the implementation of the Global Plan of Action for AnGR in Europe. 
 
•to assist and enhance the AnGR activities of NCs at the European level. 
•to develop and maintain regular contact and exchange of relevant information on AnGR horizontally between European NCs and EAAP and vertically with the Global Focal Point in Rome using existing structures. 
• to stimulate the funding and organisation of regional projects, research, workshops and national programmes for AnGR within the European Region. 
•to maintain an appropriate liaison with the European Commission, the FAO Commission on Genetic Resources for Food and Agriculture, the Secretariat of the Convention on Biological Diversity and regional and international NGOs.  For scientific aspects, it is supported by the European Association of Animal Production’s Working Group on Animal Genetic Resources (EAAP WG-AGR). 
 
•to stimulate and coordinate the maintenance and further development of national and regional AnGR databases and to encourage European information networking on AnGR.

column23:
In Europa dominieren die Interessen der Lebensmittelwirtschaft den Lebensmittelmarkt. Der Anspruch des Europäischen Lebensmittelrechts, die Verbraucher vor Gesundheitsgefahren und Täuschungen präventiv zu schützen, ist in der Praxis nicht erfüllt. foodwatch setzt sich dafür ein, dass die Gesetze und Regeln des Lebensmittelmarktes die Interessen und Rechte der Verbraucher schützen und stärken. foodwatch will dieses Ziel durch Kampagnen, durch und mit den Verbrauchern erreichen. 
Verbraucher haben ein Recht auf ausreichend Nahrung! foodwatch will, dass jeder Mensch sich ausreichend Lebensmittel und eine ausgewogene Ernährung leisten kann. Das Wirtschaften in einem Teil der Welt darf nicht zu Hunger oder Armut in anderen Teilen der Welt führen.  
Verbraucher haben ein Recht auf transparente Information! foodwatch akzeptiert nicht, dass Verbraucher beim Einkauf  wie Lebensmitteldetektive recherchieren müssen, um zu erfahren, was in unseren Lebensmitteln steckt. Wir wollen verstehen können, wie ein Produkt zusammengesetzt ist. Und uns darauf verlassen können, dass die Angaben wahrheitsgemäß und verständlich sind. Die Informationspflichten von Unternehmen, wie auch Behörden müssen sich endlich an den Bedürfnissen der Verbraucher ausrichten.

column25:
As cross-border issues are cross-sectoral issues, most of the EU initiatives, policies and legislative files are interesting for us to follow. 
Some of the fields we are working on are: probation work ; health ; intercultural work / integration. 
Of course we have a special attention to the initiative that are directly related to cross-border cooperation like: 
-INTERREG Programms 
-the Cross-Border Review launched by DG Regio (we are member of the Expert Group) 
-the follow up of the proposal of the Luxemburgish Presidency of the European Council (legal instrument - CBC). 
-the work of the Netherland Presidency (conference 17.3.2016) 
-the Communication that is being prepared by DG Regio (autumn 2017)
column26:
MAIN EVENTS: 
- 10.07.2012 Bruxelles: “The Future of European Territorial Cooperation: Capacity Building in Cross-Border Territories” 
- 21.09.2013 Strasbourg: "Capacity building and Cross-Border Cooperation: An Approach for the Future!" 
- 18.09.2014 Strasbourg:"Tools for capacity building for actors of cross-border cooperation" 
- 08.10.2014 Bruxelles: OpenDays Workshop "TEIN: The answer to the need for capacity building for an efficient cross-border cooperation" 
- Several Training activities and local events in the different "TEIN border regions" 
- 10.10.2017 EWRC-Workshop: Enhancing capacities of regions and cities for better cross-border cooperation 
 
PROJECT 
-The  Professionalizing  Actors  of  Transfrontier  Cooperation  –  Transfrontier  Euro-Institut  
Network (PAT-TEIN) project was launched by 8 TEIN partners from 5 border regions  
in 2012. The project received LEONARDO funding to transfer, merge and adapt pedagogical  
tools developed at the French-German border resulting in four regional-specific toolkits for  
cross-border intercultural project management.   
PAT-TEIN website: pat-tein.eu 
-Jean Monnet Project "Conflict and cooperation at EU Borders". Content: Organize several conferences in Strasbourg in order to analyse and compare the situation at different borders and enable the dialog between researcher-students-actors + Publication of an Encyclopedie on Conflict and cooperation at EU borders. 
-Microproject PL-CZ: “TEIN - platform for cross-border dialogue”. The Aim is to create a platform for cross-border dialogues between European countries with historically conflictual pasts. Content : study visits + analysis + recommandations. 
-Interdisciplinary research project. Aim: create a scientific manual for CBC. 
 
COMMUNICATION 
The TEIN website as well as the TEIN Member's website offer a good relay for spreading important information 
The TEIN brochure gives also a good overview of our network. http://www.transfrontier.eu/wp-content/uploads/2015/11/TEIN_brochure-paysage.pdf 
 
MAIN PUBLICATIONS (of the TEIN/TEIN members) 
- Toolkits: 
* PAT-TEIN Toolkit for Inter-Cultural/Cross-Border Project Management (www.pat-tein.eu) 
* Impact Assessment Toolkit (http://crossborder.ie/research-policy/research/toolkits/impact-assessment-toolkit/) 
* Toolkit for Budgeting of Cross-Border Projects (http://www.crossborder.ie/site2015/wp-content/uploads/Toolkit-for-Budgeting-of-Cross-Border-Projects.pdf) 
*Toolkit for Evaluation of Cross-Border Projects (http://www.crossborder.ie/site2015/wp-content/uploads/Toolkit-for-Evaluation-of-Cross-Border-Projects.pdf) 
- Territorial Cooperation in Europe - A Historical Perspective (http://ec.europa.eu/regional_policy/sources/information/pdf/brochures/interreg_25years_en.pdf) 
- Participation to the study “European Grouping of Territorial Cooperation as an instrument for promotion and improvement of territorial cooperation in Europe” (http://www.europarl.europa.eu/RegData/etudes/STUD/2015/563384/IPOL_STU%282015%29563384_EN.pdf) 
- Living and researching Cross-Border cooperation - 6 vol. 
* Les régions frontalières françaises (http://www.euroinstitut.org/wDeutsch/5-Veroeffentlichungen/Publikationen/7_Vivre-et-penser-coop-transf.php?navanchor=) 
* Governance in deutschen Grenzregionen  
(http://www.euroinstitut.org/wDeutsch/5-Veroeffentlichungen/Publikationen/8_Vivre-et-penser-coop-transf.php?navanchor=) 
* The European Dimension 
(http://www.euroinstitut.org/wDeutsch/5-Veroeffentlichungen/Publikationen/9.0Living-and-Researching.php?navanchor=2110027) 
* Les régions frontalières sensibles 
(http://www.euroinstitut.org/wDeutsch/aktuelles/meldungen/76-Publikation-Band-4.php?navanchor=) 
* Integration und (trans-)regionale Identitäten 
(http://www.euroinstitut.org/wDeutsch/5-Veroeffentlichungen/Publikationen/9.3_GuZ-leben-und-erforschen-Band-5.php?navanchor=)

column5: Initiative for the Development of Africa (IDA)
column9: Complexe Sicap-Point E - Bat. B -3e Et.
column23: IDA (Initiative for the Development of Africa) is an NGO that promote, through business and cultural activities, the principles of a better world and contributes, through international cooperation, to the development of the African Continent. IDA links up its members, offers them quality services and provides a network for the BUSINESS MEN of AFRICA and THE REST of the WORLD to work together. Doing the development of the Continent we also support the economic, social, cultural, scientific, legal and administrative matters for human rights and fundamental freedoms.
column25:
In 2017 we got the Special Consultative Status of ECOSOC, we have signed a MOU with the Women Senegal Ministry and a MOU with the Ghana Governament. 
We are a strategic partner of ECOWAS and together we are involving the EU for a couple of social projects: 
- women indipendence (social/humanitarian project). 
We help women in Africa learn simple farming and processing techniques to help them produce market ready products such as nut oils, fruits and biodiesel fuels.  We also teach them basic business skills so they can take control of their own future and become independent entrepreneurs.  
We have already installed a pilot machine to produce peanuts oil and cake, in Senegal; two more cooperatives are starting the oil production, because we have installed the machines for two coopratives. 
- obstetric fistula (humanitarian project) 
we are installing 3 small hospitals in Senegal, Nigeria and Ivory Coast; with the contribution of our french team. 
For the women indipendence project we have involved the Senegal Governament, the ILO, the ABFD and several others institutions. We are working with the Italian Embassy in Dakar to involve the EU institutions, so we are preparing a complete business plan of the activity to introduce the document to the EU institutions. 
see also: http://www.idainternational.org/women-independance/project-launch/
column26:
We are on going some social and economic project and for developping them we organise meetings and events. 
Our organisation publish on monthly bases an insert in Financial Afrik newspaper, the insert name is "Agenda Diplomatique Africaine"
column28:
- We have had several meeting with European Parliamentarians mainly with Mr. Angelo Ciocca. 
- We have attended to the Horizon 2020 presentation in Milan at the beginning of the 2015. We have continued to follow the program in the other italian cities. 
- We are working with the african EU representative, mainly in Senegal, to identify the way to finance and support the project for the women independence. 
- We are working with the african EU representative to identify the way to finance and support the project for the obstetric fistula project. 
- We have attended to the fight against the crime of forgery conference in Brussels European Parliament. A Mission of senior members of the Gulf countries (Gulf Cooperation Countries, GCC) for a series of meetings with politicians and European entrepreneurs, which will illustrate the possibilities with these economic exchange countries. 
- We are working to participate to some EU events for the women independence and the African development.

column23:
APPRO-Europe is an independent, non-profit, non-partisan organization with a mandate to carry out applied research, training and mentoring, monitoring and evaluations, knowledge dissemination, and advocacy to inform international development. APPRO-Europe (ASBL) is registered in Belgium and France. 
 
APPRO-Europe is partnered with Afghanistan Public Policy Research Organization (APPRO), registered in Afghanistan as a non-profit, non-government organization headquartered in Kabul with offices in Mazar-e Sharif (North), Jalalabad (East), Kandahar (South), Herat (West), and Bamyan (Center). 
  
APPRO-Europe’s mission is to facilitate critical dialogue on development aid effectiveness and policy making. This mission has two components. The first component is to measure development progress against strategic development objectives. The second component is to train and mentor civil society organizations in evidence-based advocacy and governments in evidence-based policy making.  
 
APPRO-Europe operates through funds provided by national and international development aid organizations. With the exception of evaluation reports, all research findings are disseminated as publications, downloadable free of charge from APPRO-Europe’s website at: www.appro-europe.net  
 
All research is designed and carried out independently to promote critical, yet constructive, dialogue and collaboration between parties with different agendas who share a commitment to the development and wellbeing of inhabitants in aid recipient countries.  
 
Research, training, and evaluations are carried out based on the recognition that in any policy environment there are gaps between policy outcomes and policy objectives. A second key consideration in APPRO-Europe’s approach is that all policy outcomes identify or create new problems (and opportunities), to be attended to through subsequent policy interventions informed by learning from monitoring, evaluations, and applied research.

column26:
Migration:  
 
The recent wave of migration into Europe is sourced to Africa, the Middle East, and South Asia and to a large extent is caused by ongoing instability and conflict in the Middle East and North Africa. By everyone’s admission, the European Union member countries have been ill-prepared to deal with this significant influx of refugees while, at the same time, the seemingly endless flow of migrants has created political instability in a number of transit and recipient countries. Without systemic attention to how the newcomers are accommodated in the longer term in the recipient countries and communities, there is also a high risk of social instability due to tensions between newcomers and host communities. Informed policy making on the migration crises will need to be based on applied research in the following and related areas: 
 
•    Economic Impact of Migration (home country, host country) 
•    Political Impact of Migration (host countries) 
•    Human Security (of migrants and host communities) 
•    Longer Term Integration (social, economic, and political) 
 
Given the lack of systematic knowledge on the above areas, and the pace at which the situation is changing, there is a need for systematic baseline assessments, followed by ongoing monitoring based on the findings from the baseline assessments and supplemented with key, internationally recognized, indicators of basic human rights. 
 
Trade and Development: 
 
Areas: 
•    Value Chain Development and Analysis 
•    Market Protection and Market Liberalization 
•    Bi- and Multi-lateral Trade  
 
Aid Effectiveness: 
 
Areas:  
•    Gender and Development 
•    Children and Development 
•    Youth and Development (focus on human capital, radicalization) 
•    Environment and Development 
•    Private Sector and Development 
•    Corruption and Development 
 
Training and Capacity Exchange:  
 
Policy Analysis 
Gender Mainstreaming 
Evidence-based Advocacy 
Evidence-based Policy Making 
Monitoring and Evaluation 
Good Governance  
 
Evaluations: 
 
All evaluations are designed based on evaluation criteria developed by Development Assistance Committee (DAC) of OECD and the European Commission, adapted for the local context, and carried out to establish synergies and efficiencies or lack thereof to generate recommendations for future programming. The broad evaluation criteria are: Relevance, Effectiveness, Efficiency, Sustainability, Impact, and Coherence/Complimentarity. (Additional information: http://www.oecd.org/dac/evaluation/daccriteriaforevaluatingdevelopmentassistance.htm and http://ec.europa.eu/smart-regulation/guidelines/ug_chap6_en.htm)

column23: La nostra associazione, Cova Contro, nasce per effettuare analisi ambientali nella regione Basilicata. Ci prefiggiamo l'obiettivo di informare la cittadinanza e le istituzioni di tutti quei fenomeni ambientali destinatari di scarsa attenzione da parte degli organi di controllo preposti. Attraverso attività di crowdfunding raccogliamo fondi per effettuare analisi chimiche su svariate matrici ambientali ed acquistiamo anche attrezzatura tecnica idonea a raggiungere un maggior livello di autonomia tecnica. Organizziamo anche eventi informativi su tematiche ambientali e sanitarie e collaboriamo con altre associazioni in tal senso. Grazie alla nostra attività abbiamo avviato numerose indagini giudiziarie soprattutto nell'ambito della lotta alle eco-mafie.

Registri europei sulle emissioni inquinanti E-PRTR - EPER. A nostro avviso contiene numerose falle, sia comunicative che nella raccolta dati. I dati disponibili per la nostra regione sono scarsi e non aggiornati. 
 
DIRETTIVA 2006/122/ CE - La nostra associazione possiede un know-how anche nel settore delle analisi alimentari. Purtroppo alcune direttive non sono aggiornate agli studi tossicologici maggiormente accreditati e rischiano di non tutelare bene il consumatore. 
 
EFSA - RACCOLTA DATI. Gli unici stake-holder riconosciuti sono gli enti pubblici, bisognerebbe allargare la platea anche alle ong. 
 
Direttiva Euratom 2014/87. In Basilicata abbiamo una ex-centrale di trattamento di combustibile nucleare e purtroppo sistematicamente le direttive Euratom e non solo sono state sistematicamente violate. 
 
Direttiva IPPC. Miglioramento delle prescrizioni di controllo ambientale con inserimento di controlli sanitari obbligatori e sito-specifici.

column5: Umanotera, The Slovenian Foundation for Sustainable Development (Umanotera)
column23:
UMANOTERAS' MISSION: 
 
We are developing a vision of sustainable development. We are the initiators of the necessary changes and a beacon of sustainable practices. We promote the transfer of the principles of sustainable development into a way of life. 
 
We are an example of a well organised network of creative individuals, achieving inspiring results through effective action. We live up to the principles that we advocate. 
 
WHY SD? 
Umanotera understands sustainable development as a dynamic balance between man and nature, which allows social justice and intergenerational solidarity. Sustainable development also means that people should exploit the unlimited capability of their minds instead of exploiting limited natural resources. Only in this way will we be able to leave our environment and resources to future generations in the best possible condition.

column26:
Community management of living resources: 
Through awareness-raising campaign at the national level and pilot project at the local level, the project aims to empower local communities to contribute to the transition to a low-carbon society through sustainable management of living resources in local environments. 
 
 
Plan B – Initiative for a Sustainable Development: 
Project Plan B is a network of Slovenian environmental non-governmental organizations (NGOs) and experts, forming a broad civil society platform for sustainable development in Slovenia, along with other interested stakeholders. The primary objective of the NGO network within Plan B is to support long-term sustainable operation of environmental NGOs and to strengthen the qualification of environmental NGOs in Slovenia in two ways: by encouraging their active role in the democratic processes of policy formulation and in monitoring implementation of policies, and also by encouraging their participation and partnership. A secondary objective of the project is to improve the awareness of citizens and to encourage their engagement in environmentally-oriented public matters.

column23: We are an initiative of international companies taking action against global warming and ozone layer depletion. We replace harmful greenhouse gases in our point-of-sales cooling and freezing units with climate-friendly natural refrigerants. Our goal is to make them the preferred cooling technology – in a safe, reliable and cost effective manner.

- provide a platform and communicate with the refrigeration technology supply chain, with other end-users, governments and civil society.

column23:
The Hungarian Food Bank Association is a non-profit organization that works to make a link between surplus food and people in need in Hungary in order to help reduce poverty, hunger and malnutrition. 
 
The Hungarian Food Bank Association started its work in September 2005, and became a full-fledged member of the European Federation of Food Banks (FEBA) in 2006. 
 
Since our foundation we distributed over 50 000 tons of food to more than 300 000 people in need in partnership with almost 300 non-governmental organizations and municipalities  
 
With the help of our volunteers we find and collect surplus food about to be discarded in retail stores, factories and process plants, we donate these products to specialist charities and local institutions. 
 
One of our key principles is that we receive and provide food free of charge. Our other important principle is political, religious and ideological independence. 
 
On the EUropean level we are participating in various research and development activities in order to help the issue of decreasing the global level of food waste.

column23:
BirdLife Europe is the European Division of BirdLife International, a worldwide Partnership of more than 120 bird and nature conservation organisations that works to conserve birds, their habitats and global biodiversity, working with people towards sustainability in the use of natural resources. The European Division coordinates the activities of 47 member organisations in Europe, including in all EU28 Member States. 
 
    BirdLife Europe contributes to and influences EU environmental policy making and implementation, and raises awareness about the importance of birds and biodiversity at EU, European and global levels. 
 
BirdLife Europe is committed to transparency about EU interest representation. BirdLife Europe believes that this register does not meet basic transparency standards and that it does not provide EU lobbying transparency. When registering, we have therefore chosen to give all relevant information that we consider necessary for lobbying transparency. A credible EU lobbying transparency register should include names of individual lobbyists and the issues that they try to influence, provide precise and comparable financial information on lobbying, and have effective sanctions to ensure the accuracy and completeness of the information disclosed. In an effort to arrive at a more objective way of calculating lobbying expenditures, we follow guidelines that result from consultations with public interest organisations, professionals working on lobby transparency as well as experts of US lobby disclosure legislation. Our registration is therefore providing a more comprehensive calculation of our lobbying expenses for activities that aim to influence the policy formulation and decision-making processes of the European Institutions, and a list of those who, on behalf of BirdLife International, European Division carry out such activities. 
 
Our registration is based on the guidelines for transparent registration developed by the Civil Society Contact Group and ALTER-EU. Find the guidelines on http://www.act4europe.org/register or http://www.alter-eu.org

BirdLife International members are independent, democratic, grassroots organisations, called Partners. There is one Partner per country. BirdLife International has Partners in all EU28 countries. In Europe and Central Asia, there are 46, plus Israel, so in total 48 member organisations. Together they represent 2 million members (natural persons).  
 
For a complete list of all conservation organisations in Europe see:

column23: AIM is a European Network of legal entities with the goal to tackle youth issues through Open Society, Open Knowledge, Entrepreneurship and Liquid Democracy through advocacy and an operational platform, giving a voice and better chances to its members to engage in society and civic life, with greater understanding and political involvement in the European project and reinforce its core values, cooperation and solidarity in Europe and in the World.
column25: AIM, attraverso i propri partner, partecipa a numerose iniziative legate a programmi giovanili quali, ad esempio, Erasmus+. Aim pone al centro delle proprie attività la campagna per la promozione di un Servizio Civile Europeo attualmente in via di sperimentazione attraverso il progetto IVO4ALL (erasmus+ KA2) promosso da Italia, Francia, Lussemburgo, Lituania, Gran Bretagna. Amesci è soggetto attuatore di IVO4ALL.
column26: In ambito di politiche giovanili e servizio civile tutte le organizzazioni aderenti ad AIM sono impegnate nello sviluppo e realizzazione di progetti nazionali ed internazionali, prevalentemente in ambito europeo con diverse esperienze in paesi in via di sviluppo. In diversi paesi, in particolare Italia, Francia e Portogallo, le attività svolte dalle nostre organizzazioni sono di supporto allo sviluppo di politiche, in diretta collaborazione con le istituzioni nazionali che sovrintendono le politiche giovanili e di servizio civile. Dalla data di costituzione AIM ha già realizzato due seminari internazionali per approfondire il tema di un servizio civile di carattere europeo, valutandone le intersezioni con il programma EVS (European Volountary Service). I seminari sono stati partecipati da rappresentanti delle istituzioni nazionali ed europee. A breve AIM darà vita al primo Centro Studi Europeo sul Servizio Civile.

column4: Non-governmental organisations, platforms and networks and similar
column23:
Le Réseau Semences Paysannes, créé en 2003, regroupe principalement des associations/organisations auxquelles se joint un petit collège de membres individuels. Il compte quatre-vingt dix organisations membres (groupements nationaux et locaux d'agriculture biologique, biodynamique et paysanne, associations de préservation de la biodiversité cultivée, artisans semenciers, parc naturel régional, organisations environnementales non gouvernementales, association de solidarité internationale). Ses membres sont en majorité des organisations d'agriculteurs et de jardiniers présentes sur le terrain.  
 
L’association a pour objet de créer et d’animer un réseau de savoirs et de savoir-faire ayant pour but de favoriser, développer et promouvoir la gestion dynamique de la biodiversité dans les fermes et les jardins, la conservation, la sélection et la multiplication de semences et plants issus de variétés adaptées à un terroir ou à des modes de production agro-écologiques. Les actions contribuant à cet objet sont la collecte et la diffusion des savoirs, savoir-faire et informations existants, l'implication dans les programmes de recherche et de sélection participatives, la formation, la valorisation des pratiques paysannes, l'expérimentation et l'appui au plaidoyer pour la reconnaissance juridique des semences paysannes.
column25:
Le RSP participe ou a participé, en tant qu'animateur de l'expression des acteurs des semences paysannes, à plusieurs programmes de recherche participative français (PICRI, Eco-innov, Diverba, REPERE, Essaimons, ProABiodivCASDAR) et européens (Farm Seed Opportunities (FSO), Solibam, EuropAid, DIVERSIFOOD, CERERE) impliquant des centres de recherche publics (INRA en France) pour la reconnaissance scientifique des semences paysannes. 
 
La reconnaissance juridique est liée à la reconnaissance scientifique. Le RSP a noué de nombreuses relations avec les institutions nationales et européennes : directement ou par ses membres. Ses membres sont ainsi présents et actifs au Conseil national de l'alimentation (CNA), au Centre Technique Permanent des Semences (CTPS), à la Fondation pour la Recherche sur la Biodiversité (FRB), à l’Institut National de l'Origine et de la Qualité (INAO) (section Agriculture Biologique), au Haut Conseil des Biotechnologies, à l'ITAB (Commission Semences  de l'Institut Technologique de l'Agriculture Biologique), à l'Agence Bio, au Comité consultatif semences européen. Au delà du suivi régulier de ces différents instances, le RSP s'investit également ponctuellement dans des groupes de travail où son expertise est reconnue. Nous pouvons ici citer le groupe de travail « politique génétique et agriculture durable » mis en place par le Ministre de l’agriculture et destiné à concrétiser ces nouvelles orientations européennes qui a rendu ses conclusions au printemps 2011 ou le groupe de travail national du Conseil Général de l'Alimentation, de l'Agriculture et des Espaces Ruraux (CGAAER) sur les évolutions possibles du certificat d’obtention végétale (COV) en lien avec le développement de nouvelles techniques d'obtention variétale et le cas échéant d'évolutions du droit des brevets.  
 
Les membres du RSP sont aussi impliqués dans les discussions de la Convention sur la Diversité Biologique, de l'organe directeur du Traité International sur les Ressources Phytogénétiques pour l'Alimentation et l'Agriculture et de celles de l'Union pour la Protection des Obtentions végétales.  
La mutualisation et la synthèse des informations recueillies dans toutes ces instances officielles de discussion enrichit grandement le service de veille juridique offert. 
 
Le RSP joue par ailleurs un rôle de sensibilisation sur les enjeux, notamment réglementaires, liés à la production et à la commercialisation des semences (conférences, séminaires, formations). 
Les positions du RSP et de ses membres sont construites sur la base du travail de veille et d'expertise de la veille juridique. L'argumentation juridique pointue et rigoureuse du RSP et de ses membres participe à la reconnaissance croissante du RSP et de ses membres par les différentes parties prenantes. Ainsi, le travail de veille permet d'alimenter les membres du RSP qui participent à différents instances et comités institutionnels abordant la question des semences.

column5: Национална асоциация на зърнопроизводителите/National Grain Producers Association (НАЗ/NGPA)
column9: 39 A, Vladaiska str., entr.A, ap.2, ground floor
column23:
The National Grain Producer Association (NGPA) is a sectoral organization in the Republic of Bulgaria, registered as a legal entity on 17.11.2006. Founders of the association are regional organizations of the Grain producers from all areas of the Republic of Bulgaria, who are united by the idea of a modern, competitive Bulgarian grain-growing industry. 
 
NGPA is a non-governmental, voluntary, non-political independent and a non-profit organization in the private representation and protection of the interests of its members engaged in the business sector grain. 
 
Object of the organization is representing and protecting the common economic interests of its members support and encourage the development of their business and their individual economic prosperity, and the grain industry as a whole.
column25: NGPA is mainly concerned about the Common Agricultural Policy and the relevant European legislation.

column5: Asociación Internacional de los Movimientos Familiares de Formación Rural (AIMFR)
column23:
- Los objetivos de la AIMFR son: 
 
a) Favorecer y promover el desarrollo de las acciones de todas las organizaciones de CEFFA a nivel de países, continentes y en el mundo. 
 
b) Representar los intereses de los CEFFA ante los organismos supranacionales e internacionales y establecer relaciones con ellos. 
 
c) Difundir los principios definidos en los Estatutos de la AIMFR ante la opinión pública y especialmente en los medios rurales, profesionales y familiares. 
 
d) Asegurar las relaciones e intercambios de experiencias y de material educativo entre las organizaciones de los CEFFA a nivel de países, continentes y en el mundo.
column25: Relaciones e intercambios de experiencias y de material educativo. Especialmente en formación por alternancia y desarrollo rural. Empleo jóvenes  y emprendedurismo. investigación educativa

column5: FAAAT - For Alternative Approaches to Addiction, Think & do tank (FAAAT)
column9: 8 RUE DU GÉNÉRAL RENAULT MAISON DES ASSOCIATIONS C/O FAAAT
column23:
Vision: 
 
Transparent and measurable drug policies framed by fundamental rights, grounded on sustainable development, enforcing empowerment, social justice and health. 
 
Mission: 
 
Research rigorous and ethical policy alternatives, and take action through social engineering, collective action and advocacy for ground-up democratic reformers at all level. 
 
Charter: 
 
FAAAT (Foundation for Alternative Approaches to Addiction - Think & do tank) is a transnational non-governmental, non-partisan and non-profit organization working on the issue of addiction, controlled drugs, and plant or substances liable to produce addiction. From Paris (France) and Barcelona (Spain), FAAAT centralizes the collaboration of a global network of experts. 
Our think-tank researches rigorous evidence-based and ethical policy alternatives to face political, economic, and social drug and addiction-related issues. We advocate for transparent and measurable policies framed by fundamental civic and human rights and the rule of law, grounded on sustainable development, that enforce personal and community empowerment, social justice and health. 
 
Our do-tank develops collective support, capacity building and community advocacy programs headed to peer groups, ground social movements and the nonprofit sector, for a broader involvement in policy processes at all level, through social engineering and transversal actions that merge affected populations, researchers, the health and social sector, law enforcement, policy-makers and all relevant stakeholders.

column4: Non-governmental organisations, platforms and networks and similar
column23:
EMBO is an organization of more than 1700 leading researchers that promotes excellence in the life sciences. The major goals of the organization are to support talented researchers at all stages of their careers, stimulate the exchange of scientific information, and help build a European research environment where scientists can achieve their best work. 
 
EMBO helps young scientists to advance their research, promote their international reputations and ensure their mobility. Courses, workshops, conferences and EMBO Press publications disseminate the latest research and offer training in techniques to maintain high standards of excellence in research practice.  
 
We help to shape science policy by seeking input and feedback from the EMBO community, societal stakeholders, academic and practitioner experts, and policymakers. We produce analytic reports on a range of important issue in the life sciences and in European science generally. We conduct our policy work using approaches of technology assessment, bringing in a wide range of stakeholders and views. EMBO is engaged in improving and promulgating concepts in the responsible conduct of research.  
 
EMBO supports talented researchers, selected through impartial evaluation processes, to allow them to do great science. The wide scientiﬁc scope across the full range of life science research coupled with the broad geographical reach of more than 1700 members and associate members – some of the best researchers in Europe and around the world – positions EMBO optimally to serve Europe’s life science community.

column26:
The focal point for policy research and implementation at EMBO is the Science Policy Programme. The programme examines concerns emerging from advances in scientific research, with an emphasis on the life sciences in Europe. We are focused on the governance of new technologies for advancing science, and the implications of the use of these new technologies for the public. 
  
Our major areas of interest are biotechnology and genomic technologies; responsible conduct of research; and scientific publishing with respect to open access, the usability of data underlying publications, and the reproducibility of the scientific literature. 
  
Our aim is to provide informed analyses to policymakers and other policy leaders, research administrators, and scientists for use in their decision-making processes.  
  
We conduct our work through policy research, including technology assessment. We engage EMBO Members, individuals and offices at the European level, and staff of other EMBO Programmes. We are also involved in a wide range of European and international projects. 
 
http://embo.org/science-policy 
 
As well, EMBO publishes four journals that contain science, society, and policy sections in the front ends. Topics of interest to and about European bodies are discussed there. Further, the journals themselves work on the principle that scientific publishing should be more transparent, fair, and ethical and must support a reliable, reproducible literature.  
 
http://www.embo.org/embo-press 
 
Finally, EMBO provides funding for post-doctoral researchers and young investigators, allowing them to achieve their best work and, importantly, to be mobile and to share and to gather knowledge. 
 
http://www.embo.org/funding-awards

As youth wing of ALDE Party, our main goal is to connect like-minded organisations and young people from across Europe.  
We also represent them in Brussels, and maintain the appropriate links with our mother party, our parliamentary group, ALDE, and its MEPs.  
Besides attending several congresses in the EP we also organise an annual summer academy for young people in the Parliament together with ALDE Group.
column25:
We follow the youth-related topics such as the EU youth strategy, Bologna process, Youth Employment initiative etc.  
We also have ongoing working groups and campaigns related to free trade, migration, fighting populism, minority rights, education and defence.
